results.headline: A Teenage Playboy Chases Secrets From the Past in 'Shem'
results.summary_short: An insufferable teenage playboy is sent on a wild goose chase to locate his great-grandfather's grave in Caroline Roboh's half-baked drama.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shem

results.headline: On the Road to an Indictment in 'The Big Buy: Tom DeLay's Stolen Congress'
results.summary_short: Styled as a film noir, "The Big Buy" chronicles the events leading up to Tom DeLay's indictment for illegal use of campaign contributions in the 2002 Texas Legislature elections.
results.display_title: The Big Buy: Tom Delay's Stolen Congress

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Big Buy: Tom Delay's Stolen Congress

results.headline: Random Bits of Whimsy in Croatia in 'What Is a Man Without a Mustache?'
results.summary_short: Quirks of fate give shape to "What Is a Man Without a Mustache?," a pleasant if inconsequential romantic comedy from the Croatian director Hrvoje Hribar.
results.display_title: What Is a Man Without a Mustache?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of What Is a Man Without a Mustache?

results.headline: Warning of Calamities and Hoping for a Change in 'An Inconvenient Truth'
results.summary_short: Davis Guggenheim's necessary documentary about the dangers of climate change features Al Gore as the surprisingly engaging vehicle for some very disturbing information.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of An Inconvenient Truth

results.headline: 'La Moustache': A French Mystery Plays With Notions of Conspiracy and Illusion
results.summary_short: Emmanuel Carrère's psychological mystery is a surreal reflection on perception, reality and memory.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of La Moustache

results.headline: Into the Woods, Humming to Sondheim, in 'Stagedoor'
results.summary_short: This sketchy documentary portrait of a summer camp for teenagers with Broadway stars in their eyes remains a cool distance from its subject.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Stagedoor

results.headline: 'See No Evil,' a Horror Movie With the Wrestler Kane
results.summary_short: When a busload of delinquents from the local detention center arrives at the hotel for cleanup duty, "See No Evil" devolves into an increasingly bloody and creative string of butcherings.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of See No Evil

results.headline: Michael Cuesta's '12 and Holding' Is a Story of Troubled Youth
results.summary_short: Michael Cuesta's film flashes a laser beam on the moment between childhood and adolescence when unguarded emotions and fantasies still rule, but adult experience beckons.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 12 and Holding

results.headline: A Boxer's Quest for a New Title Prompts a 'RevoLOUtion'
results.summary_short: Not even a grumpy cameo by Burt Young and some lovely shots of the Brooklyn Bridge can save a movie as punch-drunk as "RevoLOUtion."
results.display_title: RevoLOUtion: The Transformation Of Lou Benedetti

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of RevoLOUtion: The Transformation Of Lou Benedetti

results.headline: A Cult as Dysfunctional Family in 'Mouth to Mouth'
results.summary_short: Alison Murray's chaotic, semiautobiographical account of a teenage girl's misadventures in a traveling cult, occupies its own stylistic niche: the movie as acid flashback.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mouth to Mouth

results.headline: 'Lemming' Has Two Couples, One Rodent and No Tranquillity in France
results.summary_short: Dominik Moll imbues the first half of his thriller with inklings of strangeness that are at once sinister and quietly comical. But there is, in the end, less to this film than meets the eye.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lemming

results.headline: 'The King' Inspects Family Secrets and Grudges, Texas Style
results.summary_short: James March's fitfully engaging, finally exasperating film offers a dark vision of contemporary America.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The King

results.headline: Woodland Creatures Stumble Into Peril in 'Over the Hedge'
results.summary_short: No doubt the people at DreamWorks who made "Over the Hedge" would prefer that their film bring to mind animated classics like Disney's "Bambi," but no such luck.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Over the Hedge

results.headline: Letting Go of the Death Camps in 'Forgiving Dr. Mengele'
results.summary_short: For a film about death-camp survivors "Forgiving Dr. Mengele" is surprisingly uplifting and, at times, even lighthearted.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Forgiving Dr. Mengele

results.headline: A 'Da Vinci Code' That Takes Longer to Watch Than Read
results.summary_short: Ron Howard handles the supposedly provocative material in Dan Brown's best-selling book with kid gloves.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Da Vinci Code

results.headline: 'Saving Shiloh' and the Thrill of Wholesome Suspense
results.summary_short: The third film in the trilogy about a lovable beagle and the boy who owns him is touching, intelligent, admirably thoughtful and includes plenty of cute dog close-ups.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Saving Shiloh

results.headline: 'Negadon: The Monster From Mars' Headlines a Triple Bill of Anime
results.summary_short: Cities are destroyed, children disappear, kitties are parboiled. Yes, there's something for everybody in a jazzy triple bill of anime at the ImaginAsian Theater.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Negadon: The Monster From Mars

results.headline: A British Family Adrift in Africa in 'Wah-Wah'
results.summary_short: Scored to the death rattle of the British Empire in Africa, "Wah-Wah" observes the disintegration of a family through the eyes of its young son.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wah-Wah

results.headline: The Bar Mitzvah Status Wars Go Nuclear in 'Keeping Up With the Steins'
results.summary_short: This rollicking bar mitzvah comedy begins as a growling, razor-toothed satire of carnivorous consumption in Hollywood, but those growls soon subside into whimpers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Keeping Up With The Steins

results.headline: An Ex-Soldier Looks for Revenge in 'Dead Man's Shoes'
results.summary_short: Despite a powerful performance by Paddy Considine, Shane Meadows's unsparing revenge thriller is ultimately a typical slasher film at the core.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dead Man's Shoes
